comment.author: 29256742@N00
comment._content: From wikipedia: In the 1912 World Series, the Boston Red Sox beat the New York Giants four games to three (with one tie)

comment.author: 96933349@N00
comment._content:
I attended many games at the Polo Grounds in the 1940's. Especially when Stan Musial and the St. Louis Cardinals were in town.

A grandstand seat cost $1.25 and the bleachers were .50 cents!

comment.author: 21608680@N00
comment._content: Smokey Joe Wood pitched for Boston in Game 1, and defeated the Giants and Jeff Tesreau 4-3. A quote attributed to Wood after Game 1: "I threw so hard I thought my arm would fly right off my body." From the Baseball Almanac, www.baseball-almanac.com/ws/yr1912ws.shtml

comment.author: 12391922@N00
comment._content: As I scan this photo I am reminded of the times back then, and I wonder if they had a PA system to announce to the crowd.  Did they have electronic PA back then?
